gw.bizrules

Interface IRuleContextDefinition

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    RuleContextDefinitionBase, RuleContextDefinitionImpl

    public interface IRuleContextDefinition
    Rule context definition encapsulates information about the symbols available to the rule evaluation and command/action phase. An implementation must be stateless and reusable.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addVariable(java.lang.String id, java.lang.String name, IType type)
      adds a variable to the Rule Context Definition
      IRuleContextDefinition copyRuleContextDefinition() 
      RuleContextDefinitionKey getKey()
      returns the identifier of this context
      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getSymbolAndVariableNames()
      returns a list of the names of the context symbols and variables
      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getSymbolNames()
      returns a list of the names of the context symbols
      IType getSymbolType(java.lang.String symbolName)
      returns the type of a symbol specified by name
      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getVariableNames()
      returns a list of the names of the context variables
      IType getVariableType(java.lang.String variableName)
      returns the type of a variable specified by name
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Map<java.lang.String,IType>> getVariableTypesByName()
      returns variable map by publicID,(name, type)
      void removeVariable(java.lang.String id)
      removes a variable from the Rule Context Definition
